title: BRP query fails when specifying missing/invalid components

labels.name: S-Needs-Design
labels.description: This issue requires design work to think about how it would best be accomplished

labels.name: A-Dev-Tools
labels.description: Tools used to debug Bevy applications.

body:
## Bevy version

Bevy `0.16.0-rc.5`

## What you did

- Run the example server:
```sh
cargo run --example server --features="bevy_remote"
```
- Run the "Add strict field to BRP bevy/query" example in the [0.15 to 0.16 migration guide](https://bevyengine.org/learn/migration-guides/0-15-to-0-16/#add-strict-field-to-brp-bevy-query):
```sh
curl -X POST http://localhost:15702 -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "bevy/query", "id": 0, "params": { "data": { "components": [ "foo::bar::MyComponent" ] } } }'
```
Formatted JSON:
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "bevy/query",
  "id": 0,
  "params": {
    "data": {
      "components": [
        "foo::bar::MyComponent"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

I tried with or without `"strict": false`, same issue.

## What went wrong

Expected result: return an empty list of entities, since `foo::bar::MyComponent` doesn't exist:
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 0,
  "result": []
}
```

Actual result: an error.

```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 0,
  "error": {
    "code": -23402,
    "message": "Unknown component type: `foo::bar::MyComponent`"
  }
}
```

It seems PR <https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/16725> didn't work as expected.

## Additional information

The migration documentation example query has an issue: it should have `jsonrpc": "2.0"` since this is required, otherwise Bevy replies with an error.
